intro: Spergularia viscosopubescens, commonly known as sticky pubescent sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous growth habit and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are often covered in a fine, sticky pubescence, giving it its common name. It is commonly found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid environments.
